bitor

Bit-wise OR

Syntax

C = bitor(A, B)
C = bitor(A, B, assumedtype)

Input argument

A

a variable: double, logical, integer

B

a variable: double, logical, integer

assumedtype

'int64', 'int32', 'int16', 'int8', 'uint64', 'uint32', 'uint16' or 'uint8'.

Output argument

C

Bit-wise OR result

Description

C = bitor(A, B) returns the bit-wise OR of A and B.

Example

A = uint16([0 1; 0 1]);
B = uint16([0 0; 1 1]);
R = bitor(A, B)

See also

bitand, bitxor.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
